reviewText: Give it up with the 100.00 prices for movies like this. And to the studios of Hollywood who refuse access to good old films, go pound sand all of you.
summary: One Star for Sellers and Studios
Title: N/A

reviewText: Lloyd Bridges and Shirley Jones are wonderful as two strangers who meet while staying at a country inn at Christmastime. Lloyd Bridges is in town to visit his wife who is in a mental hospital; Shirley is there to pick up her son from his private school and to decide if she wants to try and reconcile with her cheating husband who is in London. As Lloyd and Shirley's friendship turns to passion and love, they slowly reveal the sad secrets they've been holding inside.Scenes in the village and snowy countryside of a quaint New England town add to the warmth and fun of the movie. Cloris Leachman and Lynn Carlin are wonderful in their roles and Lloyd's son, the actor Jeff Bridges, plays him as a young man.A poignant, but satisfying ending makes this a movie to watch more than once.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Bridges and Jones are excellent in this adult Christmas story about two parents leading difficult lives but crossing each other in a small New England town at Christmas. This film is by Robert Anderson, a remarkable playwright, who wrote dramas for mature life in the 50s. This TV movie needs to be in general circulation rather than cost hundreds of dollars.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie really does show the true meaning of Christmas. The best part of Christmas is having someone to share it with.  This is a bittersweet and effective portrayal of two lonely people who share a brief interlude.  It is typical of Universal to only release it on tape and only once.  The people at Universal have no clue as to what is a good movie anymore and what should be put on dvd. I feel bad for all the people that have to buy a copy from here and pay up to 100.00 dollars for a low quality tape.  I just hope that Universal wakes up and brings this charming film to dvd before it deteriorates on their shelves like so many of their other classics.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I saw this TV film only once in the 70's.  I never forgot it.  I finally bought a DVD of it for this Christmas and I'm glad I did.  Here is a Very Fine Christmas Movie for folks other than the kiddies.  They have plenty to watch anyway.  This film is Head and Shoulders above the crappy Hallmark channel treacle we now see. I highly recommend this TV movie for the holidays. Fine acting, an intelligent script and story make this truly a good choice to watch anytime but especially during the Christmas season. You will love it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This poignant, touching film has lingered in my memory over the decades. Made during a time when TV was open to quiet, offbeat, even artistic filmmaking, it's a deeply human & tender story. Lloyd Bridges & Shirley Jones are superb as two decent, lonely people who meet by chance during the Christmas season, yearning for just a few moments of happiness & joy. Yet circumstances & their own innate strength of character makes anything more lasting impossible. Jeff Bridges, in one of his earliest acting appearances, is equally good playing Lloyd Bridges as a young man. In fact, the only thing wrong with this film is that it isn't available on DVD, which is a shame -- there's still an audience for quality filmmaking, isn't there? I'd like to think so -- highly recommended!
Title: N/A
